page.title: 04Marley Tiles
page.content: Marley Tiles has produced tiles since 1953. The factory produces 95 tiles a minute which is 15 million tiles per year. The raw materials are a special grade of sand called sharp sand from Cumbria and Ebchester,cement from Eastgate,colour from Germany (Beyers) and water from the mains.These are mixed and become wet morter.This is then put into pallets,chopped,dried and stacked.This occurs on a conveyor belt and is a continuous process.The four basic tile designs are Bold roll,Mendip,Wessex and Modern.All the tiles are sold within 40miles of the factory and are transported by road.The employees live locally,66 work in the factory,15 drive wagons and 39 are staff in the office.
